programme.title: The Salisbury Poisonings
The Salisbury Poisonings
Truciciele z Salisbury
The Salisbury Poisonings
programme.desc:
The Salisbury Poisonings: With Rafe Spall, Anne-Marie Duff, Judah Cousin, Annabel Scholey. Three episode, fact based drama from the BBC, about the 2018 Novichok poisoning crisis in the city of Salisbury." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt10394886/","name":"The Salisbury Poisonings","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTFiM2JjMzktZGY0Ny00ODFkLWJlYTEtNTM3N2RlMDE3YmQxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc3MjQzNTI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three episode, fact based drama from the BBC, about the 2018 Novichok poisoning crisis in the city of Salisbury.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10394886/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kris-gray"},"dateCreated":"2020-06-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Excellent stuff","reviewBody":"So to the one star reviewers, are you being paid to do them?

Let's start with ricpambon - well he has only submitted this one review, that should tell you something. He says that Dawn sprays the liquid on her wrist in the first episode, she doesn't, she may well spray something then but not from the Novichok bottle. The people involved were interviewed for the series and I would have though Charlie could have told them where he found the bottle so to say the BBC don't know is plainly ridiculous.

AnthonyVincentBruno - well is only contribution is a two line slag off of Marc Addy, did he steal your wife? No other constructive criticism, so why bother.

Smoochemail - well again the only review this person has submitted so I find that as suspect as the first one I mentioned. their erroneous comment that you don't recover from Novichok is laughable when four people quite obviously did!

pkeenor - again only this one review, how do you expect us to believe you?

dayeym - probably the only believable review, other reviews are mixed. Maybe it was too long for him but to say it's rubbish with no explanation other than it was too long isn't' right.

So to my opinion, well I used to live near Salisbury, moved abroad before this incident happened but still had family in the area when it did, still do. So i recognised a lot of the locations used, yes they did film in the city.

I thought all the cast were believable, yes even the fat bloke from the Tesco ads. When you saw the real people at the end you realised how well they were cast. As a previous reviewer stated Anne-Marie Duff was excellent and nice not to have a supermodel play the part, as the Yanks would have done. Rafe Spall well he is a chip off the old block isn't he! MyAnna Burning from Ripper Street, and more, proves what a versatile actor she is, born in Sweden, you wouldn't know it from the accent here. Then there is Annabel Scholey from The Split, I could go on, there wasn't a duff performance here,

The fact that the real protagonist are shown at the end proves they were all involved in the creation of this series. To say it was a misrepresentation of the facts is an insult those involved and particularly the family and memory of Dawn Sturgess, shame on you.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4197,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Drama","History","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2020-06-14","keywords":"poisoning,salisbury wiltshire,year 2018,nerve agent,british police","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1245863/","name":"Rafe Spall"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0240359/","name":"Anne-Marie Duff"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8982365/","name":"Judah Cousin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0645108/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043107/"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2779562265","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzNlNGI3NzMtZDRkMC00MjdkLTgwYTUtY2ViZDcwYjJlMDJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzNlNGI3NzMtZDRkMC00MjdkLTgwYTUtY2ViZDcwYjJlMDJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"In March 2018, the eyes of the world turned to the British city of Salisbury when it became the epicenter of what has been described as one of the biggest political events of the 21st century -- but until now, the heroic acts behind the headlines have not been told. Within three days of the assassination attempt on double agent and spy Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia, key agencies discovered that a lethal nerve agent called Novichok was used, just half a teaspoon of which could kill 20,000 people. Within four days, hundreds of traces were found across the city, and, just when things were finally thought to be under control, a perfume bottle containing the nerve agent was discovered, throwing the investigation into renewed chaos."}}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 10394886, Title: The Salisbury Poisonings, --- Description: The Salisbury Poisonings: With Rafe Spall, Anne-Marie Duff, Judah Cousin, Annabel Scholey. Three episode, fact based drama from the BBC, about the 2018 Novichok poisoning crisis in the city of Salisbury." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt10394886/","name":"The Salisbury Poisonings","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTFiM2JjMzktZGY0Ny00ODFkLWJlYTEtNTM3N2RlMDE3YmQxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc3MjQzNTI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three episode, fact based drama from the BBC, about the 2018 Novichok poisoning crisis in the city of Salisbury.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10394886/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"kris-gray","dateCreated":"2020-06-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Excellent stuff","reviewBody":"So to the one star reviewers, are you being paid to do them?

Let's start with ricpambon - well he has only submitted this one review, that should tell you something. He says that Dawn sprays the liquid on her wrist in the first episode, she doesn't, she may well spray something then but not from the Novichok bottle. The people involved were interviewed for the series and I would have though Charlie could have told them where he found the bottle so to say the BBC don't know is plainly ridiculous.

AnthonyVincentBruno - well is only contribution is a two line slag off of Marc Addy, did he steal your wife? No other constructive criticism, so why bother.

Smoochemail - well again the only review this person has submitted so I find that as suspect as the first one I mentioned. their erroneous comment that you don't recover from Novichok is laughable when four people quite obviously did!

pkeenor - again only this one review, how do you expect us to believe you?

dayeym - probably the only believable review, other reviews are mixed. Maybe it was too long for him but to say it's rubbish with no explanation other than it was too long isn't' right.

So to my opinion, well I used to live near Salisbury, moved abroad before this incident happened but still had family in the area when it did, still do. So i recognised a lot of the locations used, yes they did film in the city.

I thought all the cast were believable, yes even the fat bloke from the Tesco ads. When you saw the real people at the end you realised how well they were cast. As a previous reviewer stated Anne-Marie Duff was excellent and nice not to have a supermodel play the part, as the Yanks would have done. Rafe Spall well he is a chip off the old block isn't he! MyAnna Burning from Ripper Street, and more, proves what a versatile actor she is, born in Sweden, you wouldn't know it from the accent here. Then there is Annabel Scholey from The Split, I could go on, there wasn't a duff performance here,

The fact that the real protagonist are shown at the end proves they were all involved in the creation of this series. To say it was a misrepresentation of the facts is an insult those involved and particularly the family and memory of Dawn Sturgess, shame on you.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4197,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Drama","History","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2020-06-14","keywords":"poisoning,salisbury wiltshire,year 2018,nerve agent,british police","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1245863/","name":"Rafe Spall","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0240359/","name":"Anne-Marie Duff","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8982365/","name":"Judah Cousin"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0645108/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043107/"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2779562265","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzNlNGI3NzMtZDRkMC00MjdkLTgwYTUtY2ViZDcwYjJlMDJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzNlNGI3NzMtZDRkMC00MjdkLTgwYTUtY2ViZDcwYjJlMDJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"In March 2018, the eyes of the world turned to the British city of Salisbury when it became the epicenter of what has been described as one of the biggest political events of the 21st century -- but until now, the heroic acts behind the headlines have not been told. Within three days of the assassination attempt on double agent and spy Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia, key agencies discovered that a lethal nerve agent called Novichok was used, just half a teaspoon of which could kill 20,000 people. Within four days, hundreds of traces were found across the city, and, just when things were finally thought to be under control, a perfume bottle containing the nerve agent was discovered, throwing the investigation into renewed chaos."</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Salisbury Poisonings
The Salisbury Poisonings
Truciciele z Salisbury
The Salisbury Poisonings
programme.desc:
The Salisbury Poisonings: With Rafe Spall, Anne-Marie Duff, Judah Cousin, Annabel Scholey. Three episode, fact based drama from the BBC, about the 2018 Novichok poisoning crisis in the city of Salisbury." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt10394886/","name":"The Salisbury Poisonings","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTFiM2JjMzktZGY0Ny00ODFkLWJlYTEtNTM3N2RlMDE3YmQxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc3MjQzNTI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three episode, fact based drama from the BBC, about the 2018 Novichok poisoning crisis in the city of Salisbury.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10394886/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kris-gray"},"dateCreated":"2020-06-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Excellent stuff","reviewBody":"So to the one star reviewers, are you being paid to do them?

Let's start with ricpambon - well he has only submitted this one review, that should tell you something. He says that Dawn sprays the liquid on her wrist in the first episode, she doesn't, she may well spray something then but not from the Novichok bottle. The people involved were interviewed for the series and I would have though Charlie could have told them where he found the bottle so to say the BBC don't know is plainly ridiculous.

AnthonyVincentBruno - well is only contribution is a two line slag off of Marc Addy, did he steal your wife? No other constructive criticism, so why bother.

Smoochemail - well again the only review this person has submitted so I find that as suspect as the first one I mentioned. their erroneous comment that you don't recover from Novichok is laughable when four people quite obviously did!

pkeenor - again only this one review, how do you expect us to believe you?

dayeym - probably the only believable review, other reviews are mixed. Maybe it was too long for him but to say it's rubbish with no explanation other than it was too long isn't' right.

So to my opinion, well I used to live near Salisbury, moved abroad before this incident happened but still had family in the area when it did, still do. So i recognised a lot of the locations used, yes they did film in the city.

I thought all the cast were believable, yes even the fat bloke from the Tesco ads. When you saw the real people at the end you realised how well they were cast. As a previous reviewer stated Anne-Marie Duff was excellent and nice not to have a supermodel play the part, as the Yanks would have done. Rafe Spall well he is a chip off the old block isn't he! MyAnna Burning from Ripper Street, and more, proves what a versatile actor she is, born in Sweden, you wouldn't know it from the accent here. Then there is Annabel Scholey from The Split, I could go on, there wasn't a duff performance here,

The fact that the real protagonist are shown at the end proves they were all involved in the creation of this series. To say it was a misrepresentation of the facts is an insult those involved and particularly the family and memory of Dawn Sturgess, shame on you.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4197,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Drama","History","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2020-06-14","keywords":"poisoning,salisbury wiltshire,year 2018,nerve agent,british police","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1245863/","name":"Rafe Spall"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0240359/","name":"Anne-Marie Duff"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8982365/","name":"Judah Cousin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0645108/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043107/"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2779562265","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzNlNGI3NzMtZDRkMC00MjdkLTgwYTUtY2ViZDcwYjJlMDJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzNlNGI3NzMtZDRkMC00MjdkLTgwYTUtY2ViZDcwYjJlMDJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"In March 2018, the eyes of the world turned to the British city of Salisbury when it became the epicenter of what has been described as one of the biggest political events of the 21st century -- but until now, the heroic acts behind the headlines have not been told. Within three days of the assassination attempt on double agent and spy Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia, key agencies discovered that a lethal nerve agent called Novichok was used, just half a teaspoon of which could kill 20,000 people. Within four days, hundreds of traces were found across the city, and, just when things were finally thought to be under control, a perfume bottle containing the nerve agent was discovered, throwing the investigation into renewed chaos."}}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Remont w 48h 10
programme.desc: Tomasz Pągowski ponownie udowadnia, że remont pomieszczenia nie musi trwać w nieskończoność. Niekiedy wystarczą na niego jedynie dwie doby. Ekipa pokazuje, że koszty takiego przedsięwzięcia także można zredukować do minimum. Podczas prac, widzowie poznają pomysłowe rozwiązania oraz wskazówki, jak w prosty i tani sposób szybko odmienić wygląd swojego mieszkania.

programme.title: Pogotowie remontowe Wieśka 2
programme.desc: Dla wielu ludzi już sama wizja remontu jest niezwykle stresująca. Obawy okazują się uzasadnione, gdy pracownicy niesprawdzonych firm remontowych wyrządzają niewybaczalne szkody. Drugi sezon programu, w którym ceniony specjalista budowlany, Wiesław Skiba, naprawi błędy popełnione przez niekompetentnych kolegów po fachu oraz podpowie widzom, jak samodzielnie uporać się z drobnymi usterkami.

programme.desc: Najśmieszniejsze fragmenty z programów polskich stacji telewizyjnych: gafy popełniane przez prezenterów, ich nietypowe zachowania przed kamerą oraz awarie techniczne powodujące absurdalne sytuacje.

programme.title: Zieja
Zieja
programme.desc:
Zieja: Directed by Robert Glinski. With Andrzej Seweryn, Mateusz Wieclawek, Zbigniew Zamachowski, Slawomir Orzechowski. The 70s. A Security Service Major wishes to "buy" gullible priest Zieja and turn him into an agent who will discredit the opposition. The priest's interrogations become a natural pretext for a journey through the history of Poland in the twentieth century: from the Bolshevik war of 1920, through World War II, up to modern times. It turns out that the seemingly naive Father Zieja is actually a clever rebel. The world he lived in was unacceptable to him. He was ahead of his time. A lonely journey without a passport to Rome in the 1930s turned into thoughts of a European Union. Performing the Catholic funeral rites of a woman who committed suicide (during the 20s of the past century) was an protest against the church's rules. Proclaiming the slogan "never kill anyone, not even your enemies" during the Second World War, was against patriotic mythologies and foretold future pacifist attitudes. Zieja puts his life and freedom on the line in the name of moral, ethical and religious values in which he believed. The film "Zieja" is rooted in the movement of Polish Catholicism, which is based on high ethical standards, poverty and tolerance, as well as respect and love for other human beings." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10136434/","name":"Zieja","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzcyMDNiZDctYjg3OS00OTU2LWE2ZGMtZThjZmM0YmI3NjQ2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEwMTY3NDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The 70s. A Security Service Major wishes to "buy" gullible priest Zieja and turn him into an agent who will discredit the opposition. The priest's interrogations become a natural pretext for a journey through the history of Poland in","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10136434/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"morrison-dylan-fan"},"dateCreated":"2020-09-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"The passage of Jan Zieja.","reviewBody":"After having gone to see Tenet (2020) the day before I spoke to a friend on the phone about what other films were coming out. Getting told that the local Odeon were doing a one-off screening of a interesting-sounding Polish Drama later that day,I got set to meet Zieja.

Note:Some spoilers in review.

View on the film:

On opposing sides not only round the table, but also morally, Andrzej Seweryn and Zbigniew Zamachowski set the screen ablaze in Zieja and Grosicki's interrogation sequences, thanks to the stamping of feet frustration Zamachowski gives Grosicki being counted in this psychological duel with a upright, quiet confidence Seweryn has beaming from every word of Zieja.

A important figure sadly not that well known outside of Poland, the screenplay by Wojciech Lepianka spans a impressively compact bio-pic on Jan Zieja, going right back in flashbacks to Zieja's involvement in the Warsaw Uprising,to the 70's,where Zieja's liberal liturgical catches the attention of the Communists secret services.

Based around the interrogation with Zieja and Grosicki, Lepianka's consistent move to flashbacks gives what should be the centrepiece of the title a stop-start atmosphere, where just as tensions are starting to build, Lepianka steps back and enters a flashback.

Rolling up the opening sequence to Grosicki being a slob in bed, director Robert Glinski & cinematographer Witold Plociennik firmly place Zieja on the other side with graceful close-ups and splintered shadows casting a spiritual aura on Zieja.

Closely working with editor Ewa Smal, Glinski stylishly links Zieja's experience at the interrogation table with the horrors he's faced in life,via pristine match-cuts linking the flashbacks and the present into each other,along with eye-catch screen-wipes performed by Zieja walking across the screen to deliver a sermon.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":79,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-08-28","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0786614/","name":"Andrzej Seweryn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5851110/","name":"Mateusz Wieclawek"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0952498/","name":"Zbigniew Zamachowski"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0322894/","name":"Robert Glinski"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0087308/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049230/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0185099/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0503287/","name":"Wojciech Lepianka"}],"duration":"PT1H50M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Tenis: Turniej WTA w Cincinnati - mecz ćwierćfinałowy gry pojedynczej: Karolina Pliskova - Paula Badosa
programme.desc: Cykl wywiadów przeprowadzanych przez Tomka Ćwiąkałę z ważnymi postaciami ze świata futbolu. Wśród nich są mistrzowie świata, Europy i gwiazdy topowych lig. Widzowie dowiedzą się, czym zajmują się dzisiaj, jak wspominają swoje kariery oraz poznają ich plany na przyszłość.

Polska z góry. Zamki, dworki, pałace 2
Wyzwanie - nowe mieszkanie 14
programme.desc: Prowadzący Damian Urbańczyk będzie szukał idealnego lokum dla osób o rozmaitych wymaganiach i budżetach. Pojawią się m.in. niedrogie mieszkania w blokach z wielkiej płyty, apartamenty w nowych inwestycjach czy luksusowy dom pod Warszawą za kilka milionów złotych. Widzowie zobaczą, co oferuje polski rynek nieruchomości. Poznają też kolejne praktyczne porady.

credits.actor: Maciej Orłowski

programme.title: Historia największych przebojów
programme.desc: Dziesięcioodcinkowy serial dokumentalny, który przybliża okoliczności, jakie towarzyszyły powstawaniu najsłynniejszych utworów wielkich artystów muzyki popularnej. Wśród nich znajdują się Madonna, Sting, Rod Steward czy Cher.

programme.title: Festiwal Filmowy w Wenecji - relacja. Presented by Lexus
Piłka nożna: Liga francuska - mecz: Paris Saint-Germain - Clermont Foot 63
programme.desc: Agent 47 (Timothy Olyphant) jest jednym z najlepszych płatnych zabójców. Potrafi dyskretnie wykonać najbardziej ryzykowne zadania. Wymyka się z kolejnych pułapek zastawianych przez Interpol, wywiady kilku państw i najemników. ICA, agencja dla której pracuje, zleca mu zlikwidowanie rosyjskiego prezydenta. Operacja w Sankt Petersburgu kończy się pomyślnie, ale 47 dowiaduje się, że świadkiem egzekucji była luksusowa prostytutka Nika Boronina (Olga Kurylenko). Spotkanie z kobietą zmienia jego życie.

credits.actor: Frank Lammers, Hetty Heyting, Michael De Roos, Jörgen Scholtens, Anne van Lieshout, Joost Prinsen

programme.title: Spitsbergen
programme.desc: Magda (Magdalena Czerwińska), zawieszona ratowniczka medyczna, otrzymuje nagłe wezwanie. Oznacza to dla niej powrót do dramatycznych wydarzeń i ludzkich tragedii. Gdy opada poziom adrenaliny, kobieta przypomina sobie podróże na Spitsbergen - mroźną norweską wyspę na Morzu Arktycznym. To miejsce stało się dla niej powodem traumy, z którą do tej pory nie zdołała się uporać. Przerastają ją cudze nieszczęścia i własna przeszłość.

credits.actor: Magdalena Czerwińska
Marek Kossakowski

Marian Dziędziel
Joanna Jarmołowicz
Katarzyna Raduszyńska
Magdalena Woleńska

programme.title: Jestem Andrzejem
programme.desc: Marek, introwertyczny informatyk po trzydziestce, próbuje odnaleźć się w szalonym świecie swojej młodszej dziewczyny Julki. W wyniku kłótni para się rozstaje. Marek samotnie wraca do domu, przechodząc przez ulicę zostaje śmiertelnie potrącony przez samochód. W ten sposób trafia do zaświatów. Dzięki pomocy tajemniczego chłopaka udaje mu się wrócić do żywych.

credits.actor: Bartosz Młynarski
Eliza Rycembel
Michał Darewski
Małgorzata Wichuńska
Andrzej Brzózka
Karol Marczak

programme.title: Czy na pewno umiesz gotować? 2
programme.desc: Mistrzowie domowej kuchni poznają prawdę o swoim kulinarnym talencie. Bohaterem każdego odcinka jest osoba zgłoszona przez rodzinę. Każdy myśli, że został wybrany ze względu na swoje zdolności. Tymczasem okazuje się, że bliscy mają już dość przesolonej lasagne, mdłej pomidorówki lub twardych schabowych, ale boją się powiedzieć to wprost kucharzowi amatorowi. Znany szef kuchni Andrzej Polan ocenia umiejętności swoich gości i pomaga im podszkolić się w trudnej sztuce gotowania.

programme.desc: Mistrzowie domowej kuchni poznają prawdę o swoim kulinarnym talencie. Bohaterem każdego odcinka jest osoba zgłoszona przez rodzinę. Każdy myśli, że został wybrany ze względu na swoje zdolności. Tymczasem okazuje się, że bliscy mają już dość przesolonej lasagne, mdłej pomidorówki lub twardych schabowych, ale boją się powiedzieć to wprost kucharzowi amatorowi. Znany szef kuchni Andrzej Polan ocenia umiejętności swoich gości i pomaga im podszkolić się w trudnej sztuce gotowania.

Grunt to ogród
programme.desc: Katarzyna Bellingham, profesjonalna ogrodniczka, zaprasza do swojego ogrodu na Kaszubach. W tej sielskiej scenerii pokaże, jak pielęgnować rośliny, by zdrowo rosły i dawały obfite plony. Podpowie, jak zadbać o kwiaty doniczkowe i zaplanować rabaty.

programme.title: Festiwal Filmowy w Wenecji - relacja. Presented by Lexus
Koszykówka mężczyzn: Superpuchar Hiszpanii - mecz finałowy
programme.desc: Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis zwana Jackie, była żoną 35. prezydenta Stanów Zjednoczonych Johna F. Kennedy'ego, który sprawował ten urząd w latach 1961-1963. Twórcy dokumentu przedstawiają sylwetkę i losy byłej pierwszej damy, uważanej za ikonę stylu i jedną z najpopularniejszych kobiet w XX wieku.

I Am Jackie O
programme.desc: I Am Jackie O: Directed by Tanya Maryniak, Anna Wallner. With Carl Sferrazza Anthony, Christopher Andersen, James Hart, Jeremy Scott. She was also complex, layered, and extremely guarded, making her endlessly fascinating and enigmatic. programme.title: Cena dziewictwa
programme.desc: Dokumentalistka Feriel Ben Mahmoud sprawdza, jak wygląda traktowanie dziewictwa w różnych miejscach świata. Mimo rewolucji seksualnej, moda na wstrzemięźliwość i czystość nadal jest popularna w wielu krajach, kulturach i religiach. Świadczą o tym m.in. organizowane bale czystości. Reżyserka chce poznać przyczyny takiego stanu rzeczy, a przy okazji obala wiele mitów na temat dziewictwa.

Woda dla słoni
Water for Elephants
programme.desc:
Water for Elephants: Directed by Francis Lawrence. With Reese Witherspoon, Robert Pattinson, Christoph Waltz, Paul Schneider. Set in the 1930s, a former veterinary student takes a job in a travelling circus and falls in love with the ringmaster's wife." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1067583/","name":"Water for Elephants","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1397594649","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA0MzA4MjYxOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzc1NTYzNTE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA0MzA4MjYxOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzc1NTYzNTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A veterinary student (Robert Pattinson) abandons his studies after his parents are killed and joins a traveling circus as their vet, where he meets animal trainer August (Christoph Waltz) and his wife Marlena (Reese Witherspoon)."},"datePublished":"2011-04-22","description":"Set in the 1930s, a former veterinary student takes a job in a travelling circus and falls in love with the ringmaster's wife.","keywords":"animal abuse,circus,elephant,ringmaster,train","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1067583/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"GlimmerBunny"},"dateCreated":"2011-04-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"A truly spectacular movie!","reviewBody":"OK, I'll try to tell you a bit of what I thought about "Water for Elephants", without spoiling anything. I have not read the novel (even though I plan to do it now) so I'm only offering my views on the movie.

First of all: It's amazingly beautiful. The costumes and sets are gorgeous, the cinematography is exquisite, the animals are cute (especially Rosie the elephant) and the three leads are very easy on the eyes as well. 

Robert Pattinson was actually quite good. This was a surprise to me, since I didn't really think he was anything special in any of the Twilight movies or "Remember Me". He looked very appropriate for the time the movie was set in, and even though I love Emile Hirsch (who auditioned for Jacob too) I'm confident that Robert was the best choice there was for this role, it was perfect for him. Hal Holbrook was also very fitting for the role of older Jacob. The two actors really made me believe that they were the same person in different stages of his life.

Reese Witherspoon was okay. She looked beautiful, was charming and cute but it felt like something was missing - however, I can't think of any other actress I would have liked better in the role, so I came to the conclusion that it was probably the character Marlena that was a little bland, not Reese. 

But the true star of this movie was Christoph Waltz. I may be a bit biased since I loved him in "Inglorious Basterds", but he was even more perfect in this movie. His portrayal of August was amazing, he made him likable and interesting and I was always compelled by his scenes. The character reminded me a lot of Miles in "King Kong" (played by Jack Black), a character that also wanted fame and success more than anything and used questionable and even cruel methods to get it. He was terrifying in some scenes too, but always believable. Also, in the beginning of the movie i really felt the chemistry between August and Marlena, which made the character even more interesting; however, I did feel like Jacob and Marlena had chemistry too, and in my opinion this way it was more realistic (both men loved her and she also cared about both of them). 

I loved the movie, and I really recommend it to everyone. I would sincerely give it 10/10 stars. Of course there was some parts of the movie I didn't like (particularly towards the end of it), but overall it was a magical, spectacular and epic period movie, and I can't wait to see it again!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":112523,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"duration":"PT2H2M"}</script><metacontent="

First of all: It's amazingly beautiful. The costumes and sets are gorgeous, the cinematography is exquisite, the animals are cute (especially Rosie the elephant) and the three leads are very easy on the eyes as well. 

Robert Pattinson was actually quite good. This was a surprise to me, since I didn't really think he was anything special in any of the Twilight movies or "Remember Me". He looked very appropriate for the time the movie was set in, and even though I love Emile Hirsch (who auditioned for Jacob too) I'm confident that Robert was the best choice there was for this role, it was perfect for him. Hal Holbrook was also very fitting for the role of older Jacob. The two actors really made me believe that they were the same person in different stages of his life.

I loved the movie, and I really recommend it to everyone. I would sincerely give it 10/10 stars. programme.title: 11 września - historie ocalałych
programme.desc: Reżyser Arthur Cary powraca do dramatycznych wydarzeń z 11 września 2001 roku. Rozmawia z osobami, które przeżyły ataki na World Trade Center i Pentagon. Spotyka się też z bliskimi pasażerów lotu United Airlines 93, którzy przeciwstawili się terrorystom. Razem z bohaterami dokumentu zastanawia się, jak ten tragiczny dzień zmienił ich życie, a także Amerykę i cały świat. Poruszające opowieści ilustrują bogate materiały archiwalne.

programme.title: Festiwal Filmowy w Wenecji - relacja. Presented by Lexus
Piłka nożna: Liga angielska - mecz: Manchester United FC - Newcastle United FC
programme.desc: Cykl wywiadów przeprowadzanych przez Tomka Ćwiąkałę z ważnymi postaciami ze świata futbolu. Wśród nich są mistrzowie świata, Europy i gwiazdy topowych lig. Widzowie dowiedzą się, czym zajmują się dzisiaj, jak wspominają swoje kariery oraz poznają ich plany na przyszłość.

programme.title: THE LEGENDS z Tomkiem Ćwiąkałą
programme.desc: Cykl wywiadów przeprowadzanych przez Tomka Ćwiąkałę z ważnymi postaciami ze świata futbolu. Wśród nich są mistrzowie świata, Europy i gwiazdy topowych lig. Widzowie dowiedzą się, czym zajmują się dzisiaj, jak wspominają swoje kariery oraz poznają ich plany na przyszłość.

programme.title: Żużel: Grand Prix Danii - 9. runda
programme.desc: Zdegradowany pracownik banku Martin 'Marty' Duran (Beau Knapp) odnawia znajomość z właścicielem sklepu i komputerowym geniuszem, Earlem (Jeremie Harris). Niebawem wraz dawnym kumplem, który zajmuje się kryptowalutami, wpada na trop spisku na globalną skalę. Od tej pory przyjaciołom grozi śmiertelne niebezpieczeństwo.

programme.title: Search and Destroy
Oko za oko
Search and Destroy
programme.desc: Search and Destroy: Directed by Danny Lerner. With Dylan Bruce, Sergey Badyuk, Julian Kostov, Tim Fellingham. When American Ranger John Cutter fails to save a family being held hostage and loses his entire team in a battle with infamous Ukrainian Arms Dealer Igor Rodin, John is discharged from the army. Three years later he is approached by his old General to go on a private contract mission when Igor resurfaces." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt11791146/","name":"Search and Destroy","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTlhYjU5N2EtODdiYy00MjY3LThmZWItY2YwMGYyNDE3NDkwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjg3NDA1MDM@._V1_.jpg","description":"When American Ranger John Cutter fails to save a family being held hostage and loses his entire team in a battle with infamous Ukrainian Arms Dealer Igor Rodin, John is discharged from the army. Three years later he is approached by ","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11791146/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kosmasp"},"dateCreated":"2021-08-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Destroy they did (it)","reviewBody":"Not sure you have much to search for here. And it is a shame. Everyone involved seems like good people (there is some behind the scenes stuff at the end of the movie, during the credits) ... but I can't in good conscience say or rate this really high. And I usually am really someone who cuts movies slack ... but again I just can't in this case.\n\nIt was dreadful to watch - and while there have been worse production values in other movies ... this does not make the watching experience any better. If you can laugh all the way through it, as someone else obviously did and had a "good time" therefor ... well go for it. programme.title: Poranek kojota
Poranek kojota
programme.desc: Poranek kojota: Directed by Olaf Lubaszenko. With Maciej Stuhr, Karolina Rosinska, Michal Milowicz, Magdalena Kumorek. Kuba, a young cartoon artist who works as a waiter at sophisticated parties, falls in love with beautiful Noemi and accidentally gets involved in gangster affairs." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0293901/","name":"Poranek kojota","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDA4MzYxNzMtYmEzZS00YzNiLTlkYTEtODM5MzVmYjBmZjUyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc4MzI2NQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Kuba, a young cartoon artist who works as a waiter at sophisticated parties, falls in love with beautiful Noemi and accidentally gets involved in gangster affairs.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0293901/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"joannawozniak11"},"dateCreated":"2013-01-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Awful awful bad horrid exceptionally and beyond belief, waste of time. Put it away!","reviewBody":"If I was Olaf Lubaszenko I wouldn't leave my house without plastic surgery. I would be walking backwards. I would be so ashamed my toes would fall off. On the other hand he's doing just fine and surprisingly made more of the similar stuff whilst holding his head high. :) Anyway, if you are looking for mind numbing film that is hopelessly aspiring to be funny... well ...go ahead. The only amusing thing about it is bad acting and naive dialogs written by somebody who stayed forever young - prepuberty young. In other words It's a kids move if it wasn't for swearing (a lot) and fornicating. I mean the kind of humour about brushing teeth with bum dirty toothbrush... Seriously? I got given a box set of classic Polish comedies for Christmas and I'm fuming. What a delinquent decided it complements this particular movie collection!? Cringing bad. I know some people like it and I don't judge them at all. They even went to cinema to see it... Aiiii ... So bad...so bad .... I'm so sorry for being so outspoken but I just can't find any better way to describe it. So bad... It makes dumb and dumber 2 an Oscar winning masterpiece. In fact I'm ashamed I watched it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3469,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2001-08-24","keywords":"tape over mouth,person in a car trunk,boyfriend girlfriend relationship,cartoonist,cartoonist as protagonist","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0836137/","name":"Maciej Stuhr"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0743029/","name":"Karolina Rosinska"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0590578/","name":"Michal Milowicz"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0523821/","name":"Olaf Lubaszenko"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0466864/","name":"Mikolaj Korzynski"}],"duration":"PT1H40M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Marek Edelman... i była miłość w getcie
programme.desc: Zmarły w 2009 roku Marek Edelman był ostatnim przywódcą powstania w getcie warszawskim. Przed swoją śmiercią odpowiedział na pytanie, czy w getcie była miłość i jak ona się przejawiała. Film jest odpowiedzią na książkę Marka Edelmana i Pauli Sawickiej o tym samym tytule, która zawiera wspomnienia mężczyzny. Przy jego scenariuszu współpracowała Agnieszka Holland, a jego fabularyzowane sceny współreżyserował Andrzej Wajda.

programme.title: Polska z góry. Zamki, dworki, pałace 2
Polska z góry. Zamki, dworki, pałace 2
Historia największych przebojów
programme.desc: Dziesięcioodcinkowy serial dokumentalny, który przybliża okoliczności, jakie towarzyszyły powstawaniu najsłynniejszych utworów wielkich artystów muzyki popularnej. Wśród nich znajdują się Madonna, Sting, Rod Steward czy Cher.

bit of a letdown","reviewBody":"Marie Curie became more prominent after her death especially around the early years this century, so a film about her life and achievements was a welcome view. There are a few changes in the facts, probably to make this move more dramatic, but perhaps the book from which this film derives, was written like that. The tough days in Marie Curie's life when she arrived in Paris is hardly touched, which undoubtedly lead to her stubborn attitude which is over characterized in this film. In real life she was not such a hard and difficult person.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":13549,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"duration":"PT1H49M"}</script><metacontent="

married couples adjust to the vast social and economic changes taking place in China from the 1980s to the present.","keywords":"china,non linear,nonlinear timeline,hospital,loss of son","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9581076/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"liuruiorp"},"dateCreated":"2019-12-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"A dreamy observation of a changing nation","reviewBody":"In very many ways this film is almost a reboot of Zhang Yimou's film To Live, from 1994, which tells the many trials and tribulations of a family from the founding of the People's Republic in 1949 to the end of the Cultural Revolution in 1976. So Long My Son picks up that chronological baton, and tells a story about family bonds, the meaning of friendship and what constitutes our morals and ethics through the last 30/40 years of Chinese history, from a stilted, materially basic time of 1980 through to the hypermodernity of China in the 2010s.

In the same way To Live aimed thinly disguised critiques at the Chinese government's policies through showing its impact on ordinary people, So Long My Son fires a number of shots too and it's in fact a little surprising to me some of these have been overlooked by the censors. The most obvious of them is the criticism of the one child policy, but hidden in there too are mentions of the privatisation of state owned industries in the early 90s and the mass redundancies that went with them, as well as criticism of the wealth inequality of modern China that has ensued from the market economy transition of the 80s and 90s.

I'm unsure if this was a problem specific to the release version I saw, though I have seen other reviews saying the plot was hard to follow, but I noticed that the English subtitles was often only translating about 1/5 of the dialogue in Mandarin. As a speaker of both, I followed the plot and characters quite easily, but can absolutely understand why many reviewers and comments have said they found the characters and plots hard to distinguish if the subtitling was a problem. However, with one eye on the subtitles, I think the fact they were missing a lot of the Mandarin dialogue would have created a really dreamy plotline that complements well the cinematographic style deployed - long panoramic shots that suddenly cut into a character's perspective; languid sequences that soak in the environment; and shots designed to make the audience feel voyeurs in a private situation.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3436,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"duration":"PT3H5M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Family Weekend
Rodzinny weekend
Family Weekend
programme.desc:
Family Weekend: Directed by Benjamin Epps. With Kristin Chenoweth, Matthew Modine, Olesya Rulin, Joey King. When her family misses her jump roping competition, a 16-year-old girl and her siblings hold their parents hostage, hoping to correct their unsatisfying behavior." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1821426/","name":"Family Weekend","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg2MTAwNTE0M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjEwMDgwOQ@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0155693/","name":"Kristin Chenoweth"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000546/","name":"Matthew Modine"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0750037/","name":"Olesya Rulin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1219307/","name":"Benjamin Epps"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0291634/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0014925/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3213569/","name":"Matt K. Turner"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi256354073","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDkwODQ0ODE5NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU5NDIzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDkwODQ0ODE5NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU5NDIzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Frustrated by her parent's lack of support and guidance, 16-year-old Emily takes her mom and dad hostage after they miss her big jump-roping competition in hopes that it will restore order in their home."},"datePublished":"2013-03-29","description":"When her family misses her jump roping competition, a 16-year-old girl and her siblings hold their parents hostage, hoping to correct their unsatisfying behavior.","keywords":"tape over mouth,tied feet","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1821426/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"My_Pet_Mongoose"},"dateCreated":"2013-06-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Family Weeked, Not Family Comedy","reviewBody":"This was a pretty solid and unexpected comedy. I laughed out loud quite a bit and enjoyed the nicely drawn character interactions. The whole production was several steps above what I was expecting (for a film with not much fanfare).

The cast is excellent top to bottom. Kristin Chenoweth brings her usual spark. Matthew Modine, an actor I've found to be more miss than hit over the years, brings a self-absorbed charm to his part. But it's Olesya Rulin who fully inhabits her character that really propels the movie forward and serves as the heart, soul and brain of the movie. I fell in love with the character as soon as she compiled and presented a neat three-binder of The Plan.

The other characters in the family are a bit too obvious in their stereotypes but the actors manage to elevate the material enough to avoid broad caricatures. The story beats are familiar and expected, but I was charmed enough by the production to not really mind.

The movie does suffer from an odd identity crisis, though. It's rated R--a soft R with slight profanity and sexual discussion (such as anal sex) but no gore, sustained raunchiness or similar content. It's a wonder to think that this rather innocuous movie has the same rating as the Saw or Hangover films. I'm not sure if they were going for a PG-13, missed the mark, and didn't have enough cash to re-cut it or if this was planned as an R movie.

The movie probably would have done better with the larger potential audience of a PG-13 rating, especially given the 16-year old protagonist and the family-based storyline.

Recommended for those who like quirky family comedies with a slight edge to them (Little Miss Sunshine-ish) and for competitive jump-rope enthusiasts (which I did not know was a thing).","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":6696,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="

bored" mentality. This was a true man vs nature movie that really made me think about what I take for granted and I found myself wondering how I would react in such a situation. Would I talk to a volleyball? you betcha...anyone who has spent any significant time alone can relate. Bought the DVD and will watch it for years too come.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":540195,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"duration":"PT2H23M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Ex Machina
Ex Machina
programme.desc:
Ex Machina: Directed by Alex Garland. With Domhnall Gleeson, Alicia Vikander, Oscar Isaac, Sonoya Mizuno. A young programmer is selected to participate in a ground-breaking experiment in synthetic intelligence by evaluating the human qualities of a highly advanced humanoid A.I." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0470752/","name":"Ex Machina","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUxNzc0OTIxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDI3NzU2NDE@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Sci-Fi","Thriller"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2539953/","name":"Alicia Vikander"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1727304/","name":"Domhnall Gleeson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1209966/","name":"Oscar Isaac"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0307497/","name":"Alex Garland"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0390816/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0197272/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0307497/","name":"Alex Garland"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"New Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi744337689","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUyMjQzNzk0MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTE4NjM0NTE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUyMjQzNzk0MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTE4NjM0NTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young programmer is selected to participate in a breakthrough experiment in artificial intelligence by evaluating the human qualities of a breathtaking female A.I.
"},"datePublished":"2015-01-21","description":"A young programmer is selected to participate in a ground-breaking experiment in synthetic intelligence by evaluating the human qualities of a highly advanced humanoid A.I.","keywords":"artificial intelligence,turing test,minimal cast,robot human relationship,robot","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0470752/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"themissingpatient"},"dateCreated":"2015-04-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Paranoid Android","reviewBody":"Ex Machina has a very fitting sense of false intimacy. This is done visually as many of the close-ups are seen through glass. No matter how close we get to the subject on-screen, there always seems to be at least one wall of glass between us and it or them. The film also makes a very distinct contrast between it's interior and exterior shots. Outside of the facility is breathtaking landscapes. It is big, beautiful, refreshing and vibrant. Inside seems like an endless futuristic maze of glass, mirrors, plastic, chrome and dim lights. It is clean, cold and claustrophobic. A perfect setting for the subject that is explored in this tight, tense sci-fi thriller.

Ex Machina is the best science fiction film on artificial intelligence since Blade Runner. While Blade Runner is an action thriller that relies more on it's epic visuals to tell it's story, Ex Machina is a dialogue-driven psychological thriller that slowly works it's way under your skin. Thought-provoking and terrifyingly suspenseful, an induced state of paranoia may linger long after the end credits begin to roll.

The less you know going into a film like this, the better your experience will be. Alex Garland has given us a modern science-fiction masterpiece. Performances from all three leads are flawless and every other aspect of the production, from the cinematography to the soundtrack, is perfectly suited for the story. Not only is Ex Machina an amazing achievement for a directorial debut, it's Alex Garland's best written work to-date.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":492562,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"duration":"PT1H48M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Danish Girl
Dziewczyna z portretu
The Danish Girl
programme.desc:
The Danish Girl: Directed by Tom Hooper. With Alicia Vikander, Eddie Redmayne, Tusse Silberg, Adrian Schiller. A fictitious love story loosely inspired by the lives of Danish artists Lili Elbe and Gerda Wegener. Lili and Gerda's marriage and work evolve as they navigate Lili's groundbreaking journey as a transgender pioneer." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0810819/","name":"The Danish Girl","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA0NjA4NjE2Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzIxNTY2NjE@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Drama","Romance"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1519666/","name":"Eddie Redmayne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2539953/","name":"Alicia Vikander"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1720028/","name":"Amber Heard"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0393799/","name":"Tom Hooper"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0057311/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0011868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0551876/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0185309/","name":"Lucinda Coxon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2286442/","name":"David Ebershoff"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Online Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2595992089","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUwNzY4NzMxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODIyMjExNzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUwNzY4NzMxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODIyMjExNzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Watch a new trailer for The Danish Girl."},"datePublished":"2016-01-01","description":"A fictitious love story loosely inspired by the lives of Danish artists Lili Elbe and Gerda Wegener. Lili and Gerda's marriage and work evolve as they navigate Lili's groundbreaking journey as a transgender pioneer.","keywords":"transgender,gender identity,1920s,lgbtq,copenhagen denmark","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0810819/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"letig1994"},"dateCreated":"2015-09-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Touching and destabilizing","reviewBody":"I honestly found this movie very touching and delicate. It is delicate in the way it treats difficult subjects as sexuality and the discovery of one's identity in an hostile period. The fact that it is a true story makes the whole movie even more involving.

I don't think the film is perfect - but the acting, cinematography, the screenplay are absolutely amazing. I especially loved the middle part - where all the characters try to find a way out of the problem and when for the first time they seem to be facing a fracture between them.

I thought it had a great power on people even though it doesn't seem to have had the effect I was expecting (at least during the premiere in Venice).

Eddie Redmayne hasn't had enough of his Oscar and I wish him all the best for 2016!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":170167,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"duration":"PT1H59M"}</script><metacontent="

Family Weekend: Directed by Benjamin Epps. With Kristin Chenoweth, Matthew Modine, Olesya Rulin, Joey King. When her family misses her jump roping competition, a 16-year-old girl and her siblings hold their parents hostage, hoping to correct their unsatisfying behavior." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1821426/","name":"Family Weekend","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg2MTAwNTE0M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjEwMDgwOQ@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0155693/","name":"Kristin Chenoweth"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000546/","name":"Matthew Modine"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0750037/","name":"Olesya Rulin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1219307/","name":"Benjamin Epps"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0291634/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0014925/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3213569/","name":"Matt K. Turner"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi256354073","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDkwODQ0ODE5NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU5NDIzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDkwODQ0ODE5NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU5NDIzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Frustrated by her parent's lack of support and guidance, 16-year-old Emily takes her mom and dad hostage after they miss her big jump-roping competition in hopes that it will restore order in their home."},"datePublished":"2013-03-29","description":"When her family misses her jump roping competition, a 16-year-old girl and her siblings hold their parents hostage, hoping to correct their unsatisfying behavior.","keywords":"tape over mouth,tied feet","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1821426/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"My_Pet_Mongoose"},"dateCreated":"2013-06-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Family Weeked, Not Family Comedy","reviewBody":"This was a pretty solid and unexpected comedy. I laughed out loud quite a bit and enjoyed the nicely drawn character interactions. The whole production was several steps above what I was expecting (for a film with not much fanfare).

The cast is excellent top to bottom. Kristin Chenoweth brings her usual spark. Matthew Modine, an actor I've found to be more miss than hit over the years, brings a self-absorbed charm to his part. But it's Olesya Rulin who fully inhabits her character that really propels the movie forward and serves as the heart, soul and brain of the movie. I fell in love with the character as soon as she compiled and presented a neat three-binder of The Plan.

The other characters in the family are a bit too obvious in their stereotypes but the actors manage to elevate the material enough to avoid broad caricatures. The story beats are familiar and expected, but I was charmed enough by the production to not really mind.

The movie does suffer from an odd identity crisis, though. It's rated R--a soft R with slight profanity and sexual discussion (such as anal sex) but no gore, sustained raunchiness or similar content. It's a wonder to think that this rather innocuous movie has the same rating as the Saw or Hangover films. I'm not sure if they were going for a PG-13, missed the mark, and didn't have enough cash to re-cut it or if this was planned as an R movie.

The movie probably would have done better with the larger potential audience of a PG-13 rating, especially given the 16-year old protagonist and the family-based storyline.

Recommended for those who like quirky family comedies with a slight edge to them (Little Miss Sunshine-ish) and for competitive jump-rope enthusiasts (which I did not know was a thing).","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":6696,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Rad
Rad
programme.desc:
Rad: Directed by Hal Needham. With Bill Allen, Lori Loughlin, Talia Shire, Ray Walston. The story of one young man, Cru Jones, who has the intensity and desire to win a BMX race called Helltrack." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0091817/","name":"Rad","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmRmM2ZkNTAtNTZkNS00NTIzLWFkZGEtNzU0ZWEzMTRlMThlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story of one young man, Cru Jones, who has the intensity and desire to win a BMX race called Helltrack.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0091817/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"LunaC73"},"dateCreated":"2009-11-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Rad is home to me","reviewBody":"There's an old saying that "you can't go home again", but thanks to the movie Rad, I can go home anytime I want to. It was filmed mostly in my hometown when I was a kid (all but Helltrack itself, which was set up in Bowness Park in Calgary), and re-watching it now brings me back to how excited everyone was at the time. In the movie the town was called Cochrane, and was in some unknown state. In real life, the town is.....you guessed it, Cochrane, which is just outside Calgary, Alberta. And the local kids really were into BMX biking; I remember my godfather's son making a half-pipe as a shop project, and then not being able to get it through the shop door.

The high school in the movie really was pre-renovation Cochrane High. The Cobra logo on the gym wall is the real Cochrane High logo (I graduated as a Cochrane Cobra, as did my dad before me). I remember the school freaking out over whether the movie crew would be able to pull off the BMX Boogie scene without permanently damaging the gym floors. The school ended up converting the gym to a library and music room and building a new gym on the opposite side of the school, if I recall correctly thanks in part to the location fees paid.

The ice cream shop where Cru catches up to Christian is called McKay's and was Cochrane's one and only tourist attraction at the time. Cru's workplace, the Main Street Snack Bar, was real. It's been also been a café, and a Chinese food restaurant over the years, but it's there. Lucky Penny Pizza was really Cochrane's best (and for a long time, only) pizza place. The building in the background when Cru jumps the car during the parade even housed my mom's office.

Best of all in terms of hometown connection, the house that Cru's family lived in in the movie wasn't a set. It was a real house, and it was actually the first house my parents lived in after they got married.

Cochrane had a population explosion shortly after this movie was made, and has grown to the point that most people who've seen Rad would never recognize the town now. For example, there's no longer an empty field opposite the sawmill, and the field Cru and Christian ride into on the hill above the town is now home to a huge subdivision of condos. It's not a small town anymore, and the small town feel is long gone, but when I watch Rad I see my hometown the way it was when I was a kid, and it makes me smile."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5787,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Drama","Sport"],"datePublished":"1986-03-28","keywords":"newspaper boy,bicycle race,bmx bicycle,businessman,love interest","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1618394649","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjBiNzNhZTctM2M1ZS00ODU1LThhN2YtYzQ0ZDQ0OWI4ZGMyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjBiNzNhZTctM2M1ZS00ODU1LThhN2YtYzQ0ZDQ0OWI4ZGMyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0175123/","name":"Bart Conner"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0521753/","name":"Lori Loughlin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0020309/","name":"Bill Allen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0624102/","name":"Hal Needham"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033675/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0076384/","name":"Sam Bernard"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0250005/","name":"Geoffrey Edwards"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

uses skills he didn't know he had to become an extraordinary spy.","keywords":"teen hero,teenage hero,spy,teenage boy,london england","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6964748/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"klarry-98949"},"dateCreated":"2020-06-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Wow.. did not expected I will get so hooked","reviewBody":"I haven't read the books and I think this helps me to enjoy the show much better.. I have nothing to compare it with and I have zero expectations.

It is midnight in UK right now, as I'm writing this review. I'm on episode 4, I really want to go to bathroom, to get something to drink, but am totally glued to the screen. I decided to pause and write this review to express my excitement. Honestly, I don't remember when was the last time a TV show made me feel like that.. Stranger Things season 1 perhaps..

And before you start throwing stones at me, No, I am not comparing Alex Rider to Stranger Things, these are two completely different entities.

All I am saying is that I am hooked.. I am loving it! I genuinely envy people who manage to consume series after series, to binge them. Unlike them I am like that crazy picky eater with tons of allergies. It takes me ages to find something I can digest and enjoy. Tonight I found that and this makes me a very happy person this evening..

STORY

If you read the books, you know 100% more about the story than I do.

If you haven't read the books.. Good! Keep it that way, definitely there are more chances that you will enjoy this. You can always read the books later.

Personally I find the story is captivating and intriguing, the pace is excellent keeps your attention, the action is great.

CHARACTERS

Great casting. Otto Farrant, the one who plays Alex Rider is excellent. His convincing as innocent teenager and as a badass undercover spy! Loving him!

Overall not a single miscast in my opinion. All great performances so far. Well done to all the actors and to whoever done the casting on this.

PRODUCTION One word.. "Great!" (based on first 4 episodes)

Great soundtrack, camera work, action, cinematography. Again.. well done to all involved!

 So My SUMMARY to Whoever is reading this!

Please do not get discouraged by low ratings of some people. I encourage you to -**Please give it a try!** It may not be your 'cup of tea' which is fair, but if it is, I just wish that you will enjoy this series as much as I am enjoying it right now!

 Stay Safe and Take Care Reader!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":9483,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6}}</script><metacontent="

did not expected I will get so hooked","reviewBody":"I haven't read the books and I think this helps me to enjoy the show much better.. I have nothing to compare it with and I have zero expectations.

It is midnight in UK right now, as I'm writing this review. I'm on episode 4, I really want to go to bathroom, to get something to drink, but am totally glued to the screen. I decided to pause and write this review to express my excitement. Honestly, I don't remember when was the last time a TV show made me feel like that.. Stranger Things season 1 perhaps..

And before you start throwing stones at me, No, I am not comparing Alex Rider to Stranger Things, these are two completely different entities.

All I am saying is that I am hooked.. I am loving it! I genuinely envy people who manage to consume series after series, to binge them. Unlike them I am like that crazy picky eater with tons of allergies. It takes me ages to find something I can digest and enjoy. Tonight I found that and this makes me a very happy person this evening..

STORY

If you read the books, you know 100% more about the story than I do.

If you haven't read the books.. Good! Keep it that way, definitely there are more chances that you will enjoy this. You can always read the books later.

Personally I find the story is captivating and intriguing, the pace is excellent keeps your attention, the action is great.

CHARACTERS

Great casting. Otto Farrant, the one who plays Alex Rider is excellent. His convincing as innocent teenager and as a badass undercover spy! Loving him!

Overall not a single miscast in my opinion. All great performances so far. Well done to all the actors and to whoever done the casting on this.

PRODUCTION One word.. "Great!" (based on first 4 episodes)

Great soundtrack, camera work, action, cinematography. Again.. well done to all involved!

 So My SUMMARY to Whoever is reading this!

Please do not get discouraged by low ratings of some people. I encourage you to -**Please give it a try!** It may not be your 'cup of tea' which is fair, but if it is, I just wish that you will enjoy this series as much as I am enjoying it right now!

 Stay Safe and Take Care Reader!","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":9483,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:
Madame Bovary: Directed by Claude Chabrol. With Isabelle Huppert, Jean-François Balmer, Christophe Malavoy, Jean Yanne. In nineteenth-century France, the romantic daughter of a country squire marries a dull country doctor. To escape boredom, she throws herself into love affairs with a suave local landowner and a law student, and runs up ruinous debts." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0102368/","name":"Madame Bovary","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDY3YjIyMDItMWNlMS00ZDIzLWJhMDUtN2NlOTNjMmI3MGUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTAwMzUyOTc@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001376/","name":"Isabelle Huppert"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0050983/","name":"Jean-François Balmer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0539022/","name":"Christophe Malavoy"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001031/","name":"Claude Chabrol"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022545/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0055736/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0254873/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0281306/","name":"Gustave Flaubert"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001031/","name":"Claude Chabrol"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Madame Bovary (1991)","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3198616345","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmY4NDQ3ZjItNDY2OC00NWM5LTg4ZDMtZDczNmIxNWJlZTRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmY4NDQ3ZjItNDY2OC00NWM5LTg4ZDMtZDczNmIxNWJlZTRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Samuel Goldwyn"},"datePublished":"1991-04-03","description":"In nineteenth-century France, the romantic daughter of a country squire marries a dull country doctor. To escape boredom, she throws herself into love affairs with a suave local landowner and a law student, and runs up ruinous debts.","keywords":"character name as title,emma bovary character,period drama,debt,love","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0102368/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jonr-3"},"dateCreated":"2004-01-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"An impossible task?","reviewBody":"I agree with the consensus here that this film adaptation is largely unsatisfying. However, I question whether Flaubert's masterpiece can ever be translated graciously to the screen. I suspect that a novel famous for having every word exactly in place, and whose appeal lies as much in the relentless poetic flow of its prose as in the brutally frank psychological characterization of its heroine (and a few other characters!), may be forever out of the reach of other media, and might best be left to pursue its own life on paper.

I also agree that Ms. Huppert's portrayal is cold, but I've always seen Emma as being that way. After all--she's nuts. Crazy people are seldom full of human warmth. Emma Bovary is among the select handful of fictional characters neurotic enough to have given their names to a pathological condition (in this case, bovarism).

It's always possible to admire a movie for its visual beauty, and this one wins hands-down in that category. 

But if you want the full impact of the wretched, wrenching story--you have to go back to the book. I applaud Mr. Chabrol for trying, even if he didn't succeed, to make a perhaps impossible adaptation."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3644,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"duration":"PT2H23M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Rad
Rad
programme.desc:
Rad: Directed by Hal Needham. With Bill Allen, Lori Loughlin, Talia Shire, Ray Walston. The story of one young man, Cru Jones, who has the intensity and desire to win a BMX race called Helltrack." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0091817/","name":"Rad","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmRmM2ZkNTAtNTZkNS00NTIzLWFkZGEtNzU0ZWEzMTRlMThlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story of one young man, Cru Jones, who has the intensity and desire to win a BMX race called Helltrack.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0091817/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"LunaC73"},"dateCreated":"2009-11-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Rad is home to me","reviewBody":"There's an old saying that "you can't go home again", but thanks to the movie Rad, I can go home anytime I want to. It was filmed mostly in my hometown when I was a kid (all but Helltrack itself, which was set up in Bowness Park in Calgary), and re-watching it now brings me back to how excited everyone was at the time. In the movie the town was called Cochrane, and was in some unknown state. In real life, the town is.....you guessed it, Cochrane, which is just outside Calgary, Alberta. And the local kids really were into BMX biking; I remember my godfather's son making a half-pipe as a shop project, and then not being able to get it through the shop door.

The high school in the movie really was pre-renovation Cochrane High. The Cobra logo on the gym wall is the real Cochrane High logo (I graduated as a Cochrane Cobra, as did my dad before me). I remember the school freaking out over whether the movie crew would be able to pull off the BMX Boogie scene without permanently damaging the gym floors. The school ended up converting the gym to a library and music room and building a new gym on the opposite side of the school, if I recall correctly thanks in part to the location fees paid.

The ice cream shop where Cru catches up to Christian is called McKay's and was Cochrane's one and only tourist attraction at the time. Cru's workplace, the Main Street Snack Bar, was real. It's been also been a café, and a Chinese food restaurant over the years, but it's there. Lucky Penny Pizza was really Cochrane's best (and for a long time, only) pizza place. The building in the background when Cru jumps the car during the parade even housed my mom's office.

Best of all in terms of hometown connection, the house that Cru's family lived in in the movie wasn't a set. It was a real house, and it was actually the first house my parents lived in after they got married.

Cochrane had a population explosion shortly after this movie was made, and has grown to the point that most people who've seen Rad would never recognize the town now. For example, there's no longer an empty field opposite the sawmill, and the field Cru and Christian ride into on the hill above the town is now home to a huge subdivision of condos. It's not a small town anymore, and the small town feel is long gone, but when I watch Rad I see my hometown the way it was when I was a kid, and it makes me smile."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5787,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Drama","Sport"],"datePublished":"1986-03-28","keywords":"newspaper boy,bicycle race,bmx bicycle,businessman,love interest","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1618394649","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjBiNzNhZTctM2M1ZS00ODU1LThhN2YtYzQ0ZDQ0OWI4ZGMyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjBiNzNhZTctM2M1ZS00ODU1LThhN2YtYzQ0ZDQ0OWI4ZGMyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0175123/","name":"Bart Conner"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0521753/","name":"Lori Loughlin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0020309/","name":"Bill Allen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0624102/","name":"Hal Needham"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033675/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0076384/","name":"Sam Bernard"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0250005/","name":"Geoffrey Edwards"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

A bittersweet story about coming of age in the shadow of mental illness." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9690328/","name":"Paper Spiders","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGQwZmQ0MGUtNGZkZi00YTUxLTkwOTItOGIwZDNkMmY5NGZlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTM5MzAwNjk@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2901344/","name":"Stefania LaVie Owen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2572554/","name":"Peyton List"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000666/","name":"Lili Taylor"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1630654/","name":"Inon Shampanier"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0099446/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0196303/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0744004/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1630654/","name":"Inon Shampanier"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4363465/","name":"Natalie Shampanier"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3520380953","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjgxNTU5NDAtNThkZi00MDM0LWIzZmUtNjk3M2ZiNjM0ODZiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjgxNTU5NDAtNThkZi00MDM0LWIzZmUtNjk3M2ZiNjM0ODZiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"datePublished":"2021-05-07","description":"A bittersweet story about coming of age in the shadow of mental illness.","keywords":"shadow,mother daughter,coming of age,mental illness,paranoia","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9690328/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ehotchkin"},"dateCreated":"2021-05-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Brilliant Movie!","reviewBody":"This movie deserves recognition for it's cast, crew and wonderfully told story. There are very few films out there that have such a powerful message and the ability to touch the viewer in such a way. It is a profound and thought provoking film. It highlights the difficulties that arise when faced with the unique challenges of caring for someone with an illness (mental or otherwise).\n\nThe cast and crew did a great job in bringing such a wonderfully written script to life on the screen. I would absolutely recommend this film.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":986,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"duration":"PT1H49M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Me, Myself & Irene
